last_episode_to_air.name: Deadwood
last_episode_to_air.overview: The Ghost Lab team heads to Deadwood, SD, once home to such western legends as Sheriff Seth Bullock, Calamity Jane and Wild Bill Hickok. Is the spirit of Wild Bill still haunting the salooon, holding his Dead Man's Hand?

name: Ghost Lab
overview:
Ghost Lab is a weekly American paranormal television series that premiered on October 6, 2009, on the Discovery Channel. Produced by Paper Route Productions and Go Go Luckey Entertainment, the program is narrated by Mike Rowe. It follows ghost-hunting brothers Brad and Barry Klinge, who founded Everyday Paranormal in October 2007.

Everyday Paranormal is a paranormal investigation team whose stated mission is to "visit the most haunted places in America, find evidence, and test new theories to probe the existence of the afterlife" using a fringe-scientific approach.

In addition to Brad and Barry, the team included members Steve Harris, Hector Cisneros, and Katie Burr. Other members included Jason Worden, Ashlee Lehman, and Steve Hock. Ghost Lab remains the name of EP's mobile command center.

On October 14, 2009, Brad and Barry Klinge were interviewed on The Pat & Brian Show about the origins of Everyday Paranormal, current investigations, and equipment use. On October 30, 2009, Larry King interviewed the brothers via satellite on CNN's Larry King Live.

episodes.name: Disturbing the Peace
episodes.overview: Brad and Barry Klinge bring their team and their mobile lab to investigate paranormal activity at two notorious Louisiana landmarks: the Shreveport Municipal Auditorium and the Myrtles Plantation.

episodes.name: Tombstone
episodes.overview: The crew heads to Tombstone, Arizona, to see if the long-dead inhabitants of the violent Old West town are exhibiting any signs of life.

episodes.name: Smell of Fear
episodes.overview: To find out if paranormal entities really do feed on fear, the Ghost Lab team investigates alleged hot spots at the Liar's Club in Chicago and the Mortuary in New Orleans.

episodes.name: Under the Skin
episodes.overview: The team investigates a supposedly haunted tattoo parlor in Chicago and a paranormally active former bordello now used as a bed and breakfast in Fort Worth.

episodes.name: Murky Water
episodes.overview: The team investigate the Louisiana Nottoway Plantation and Chicago's Metro Club to test the hypothesis that areas near water hold more paranormal activity.

episodes.name: John Wilkes Booth
episodes.overview: The team head to Granbury, Texas, to investigate the Opera House, believed by many to be haunted by the spirit of John Wilkes Booth. Next, they move on to the Garfield Furniture store, another location in the same town, said to be linked to Booth.

episodes.name: They're Watching You
episodes.overview:
The team investigate a supposedly haunted restaurant, the Catfish Plantation, in Waxahachie, Texas, said to be haunted by a female spirit who plays havoc in the kitchen and dining room. 

Next, the team head to the Hotel Lawrence in Dallas, a location with a long history of violence, murder and suicide.

episodes.name: Shadowman
episodes.overview: The team heads to Texas and Illinois in search of the elusive "Shadowman." The investigation begins at the GDC building, a Civil War era hotel renovated into an office building. Then they head to the Volo antique mall to test the "Attachment Theory".

episodes.name: Watery Grave
episodes.overview: The team heads to Texas to investigate the Hotel Galvez which was built atop the wreckage of the deadliest natural disaster in American history. Then they investigate Presidio La Bahia where hundreds of Texan revolutionaries were slaughtered.

episodes.name: Alcatraz
episodes.overview: The Ghost Lab team heads to the notorious Alcatraz Island - reputedly America's most haunted prison - for a chilling investigation of alleged spirits that are causing the prison's present to be just as terrifying as its past.

episodes.name: Ghost of Blackbeard
episodes.overview: The Ghost Lab team embarks on a paranormal treasure hunt to track the ghost of the notorious pirate Blackbeard. Then they venture up the Mississippi to see if a majestic steamboat is still under the watchful eye of a deceased captain.

episodes.name: The Blue Ghost
episodes.overview: The team investigates the USS Lexington; a massive WWII aircraft carrier alleged to be haunted. Later, Brad & Barry check into the Ye Kendall Inn where an underground tunnel could be a passageway to the beyond.

episodes.name: If Walls Could Talk
episodes.overview: The team heads to the Lemp Mansion in St. Louis to investigate the home of a brewing dynasty that has been cursed by murders and suicide. Then they explore McPike Mansion, a rotting condemned estate with alleged apparitions and disembodied voices.

episodes.name: Dead Will Rise Again
episodes.overview: The team investigates Fairfield Inn, Fairfield, Jennie Wade House, Gettysburg and Farnsworth House, Gettysburg in Pennsylvania.

episodes.name: The Betrayal
episodes.overview: The team investigates Hill View Manor, New Castle, Pennsylvania. and Fort Niagara, Youngstown, New York.

episodes.name: Lizzie Borden
episodes.overview: The team investigates Lizzie Borden Bed & Breakfast, Fall River and Stone's Public House, Ashland in Massachusetts.

episodes.name: Afterlife Sentence
episodes.overview: The team investigates West Virginia Penitentiary and a private residence in Ohio where the owner is being plagued by apparitions.

episodes.name: Theme Park of Death
episodes.overview: The team investigates West Virginia's Lake Shawnee Fun Park.

episodes.name: Eternal Home
episodes.overview: The Ghost Lab team investigates the Shanley Hotel of Rapanoch, New York which is said to be haunted by its former owner. Later, they travel to Arkansas to determine whether a local business is haunted by its lawless past, or by a spirit with much closer ties to the cafe's current owner.

episodes.name: The Morgue
episodes.overview: The team investigates a private home in Arkansas whose residents believe it to be haunted by Native American spirits, and the Harrisburg State Hospital, a former mental institution.

episodes.name: The Innocent
episodes.overview: The Klinge Brothers investigate a Civil War era orphanage in Gettysburg which is said to be haunted by the sadistic woman who used to run the institution. Later, they check out a former funeral home where witnesses say they've had encounters with multiple spirits, including one with personal ties to the owners.

episodes.name: No Escape
episodes.overview: Everyday Paranormal visits a the Old Montana State Prison, then investigate a Tennessee home within a former state hospital where a young boy is plagued by a tormenting spirit.

episodes.name: Path Of A Killer
episodes.overview: Brad and Barry investigate the home where eight people were slaughtered in the infamous 1912 axe murders in Villisca, Iowa. Then they head to Million Dollar Lanes in North Dakota where it seems one patron has continued to bowl after death.

episodes.name: Behind Stone Walls
episodes.overview: Everyday Paranormal investigates the Pythian Castle in Missouri where spirits of POW's are said to still be behind the castle's walls. Then they travel to Illinois' Hundley House, the site of an unsolved cold-blooded double murder.

episodes.name: Chambers of Horror
episodes.overview: The Klinge brothers bring their team to "The Chambers of Edgar Allen Poe", where claims of paranormal activity have been a constant nuisance. Then they test their theories on haunted objects at a shipwreck museum where artifacts exhumed from the dark waters of Lake Superior are said to be causing unexplained activity.

episodes.name: Deadwood
episodes.overview: The Ghost Lab team heads to Deadwood, SD, once home to such western legends as Sheriff Seth Bullock, Calamity Jane and Wild Bill Hickok. Is the spirit of Wild Bill still haunting the salooon, holding his Dead Man's Hand?
